description: Dive into "Tokyo's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Tokyo's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits

places.generalDescription: Odaiba Marine Park is a coastal green space in Tokyo Bay, offering stunning views of the Rainbow Bridge and the city. It is one of several recreational beach areas in the region, along with Kasai Kaihin Park, Shiokaze Park, and Jonanjima Seaside Park. During summer, visitors can enjoy activities like grilling and bird-watching while taking in the cool sea breeze and pleasant views.

sources.snippet: Though many of the region‚Äôs most pristine beaches are an hour or two away in Chiba and Kamakura, Tokyo Bay also offers several recreational beach areas, including Kasai Kaihin Park, Shiokaze Park, Odaiba Seaside Park, and Jonanjima Seaside Park. Take a day off and journey to any of these destinations to enjoy grilling, bird-watching, and other recreational activities. During the hot and humid summer months, these parks abound with children playing in the water and local residents looking to enjoy the cool sea breeze and pleasant views.
sources.siteName: The Official Tokyo Travel Guide, GO TOKYO
sources.shortName: Enjoy the Oceanside at Tokyo Bay Beaches

places.name: Odaiba Marine Park

reviews.text: It's windy but relaxing as we saw rainbow bridge from a far. We take a tokyo cruise from Asakusa and get off here (less than an hour). We visit the liberty statue and saw also some sakura blooming there. There's also 2 malls around so we can have lunch and there's a lot of halal option. We got back to the city using train eventually and take the end car so that we can enjoy the train journey better.

Back at my go-to spot for incredible night views, which I try to visit every couple of months! It's truly breathtaking. This visit was special because I got to share it with my relatives who came all the way from their hometown. I really hope they loved it as much as I do! This place has it all ‚Äì great food, awesome shopping, and plenty of fun activities. Super convenient too, with ample parking and direct train access.

üåä Odaiba Marine Park ‚Äì A Scenic Escape in the Heart of Tokyo Bay

üìç Location: Odaiba, Tokyo
‚≠ê Recommended for: Sunset lovers, couples, photographers, families, peaceful walkers

‚∏ª

üåÖ Overview

Odaiba Marine Park offers a refreshing escape from Tokyo's busy streets, blending seaside calm with modern city views. With its sandy beach, gentle waves, and clear view of Rainbow Bridge, it's a perfect spot to unwind while staying in the city.

‚∏ª

üèñÔ∏è What to Expect
‚Ä¢	A man-made beach with clean sand - ideal for barefoot walks or relaxing on a picnic mat
‚Ä¢	Stunning views of Tokyo's skyline, especially during sunset
‚Ä¢	A replica of the Statue of Liberty, a fun and iconic photo spot
‚Ä¢	Great for casual strolls, running, or simply sitting with coffee in hand
‚Ä¢	Occasional street performers and events during weekends

‚∏ª

üì∑ Photography Heaven

Whether it's the warm glow of golden hour, the city lights reflecting on the water, or the Rainbow Bridge lighting up after dusk - this place is made for snapshots.

‚∏ª

üö´ Note

Swimming is not allowed, but that doesn't take away from the charm. The atmosphere is peaceful, romantic, and ideal for slowing down after a day of sightseeing.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Final Thoughts

Odaiba Marine Park is one of Tokyo's most scenic and relaxing public spots. Come for the view, stay for the moment. A must-visit for anyone who enjoys a touch of nature without leaving the city.

places.address: 1 Chome-4 Daiba, Minato City, Tokyo 135-0091, Japan

places.generalDescription: Kasai Rinkai Park is a vast waterfront green space in Tokyo, offering stunning views of Tokyo Bay and beyond. The park features five distinct zones, including the Kasai Rinkai Aquarium and Avian Garden Watching Center. Visitors can enjoy lush gardens, a BBQ area, and scenic pathways throughout the park.

sources.snippet: The expansive grounds of Kasai Rinkai Park include an enormous Ferris wheel, aquarium, and numerous bird-watching areas perfect for a day of Tokyo birding. Jonanjima Seaside Park is located near Haneda Airport, providing vantage points of planes taking off and landing. Odaiba Seaside Park is conveniently located adjacent to the numerous restaurants, shops, and attractions of Odaiba, so you can enjoy all the metropolitan amenities of Tokyo along with outdoor recreation.
sources.siteName: The Official Tokyo Travel Guide, GO TOKYO
sources.shortName: Enjoy the Oceanside at Tokyo Bay Beaches

places.name: Kasai Rinkai Park

reviews.text: There's a ferris wheel, an aquarium and free access to the intertidal area. The walk through the park itself is beautiful and very calming, lined with trees and spotted with park benches. A truly great spot to relax away from the crush of the city because of how large the entire area is. Really worth taking a few hours within Tokyo in.

Kasai Rinkai Park is a very beautiful and spacious park with plenty to do for all ages. It is well connected with its own station, making it easy to access, and also has a huge parking area for those driving. The park features designated barbecue spaces, fishing spots, and long running paths that make it ideal for outdoor activities. There is also an observatory and a large Ferris wheel that give great views of the area. With so much to explore, you can easily spend three to four hours here just walking around and enjoying the natural surroundings.

If you want to spend some quality time with family, you should come here.

You can come here by bus or train. Upon arrival, there is a beautiful water show. Within the street side of the park, you can find food, toilets. You can also enjoy the surroundings by a train which runs on the street, basically for kids. On the seaside, you can bring your tent or own sitting arrangements and enjoy the sea.

Also,if you want to go nearer to the sea, there is a bridge open towards the small island type portion opened till 5pm. You can do barbecue parties by reservation.

There is a big ferris wheel, the biggest I've ever seen, under 800yen (I forgot the actual price). There is a few rides too for kids.

Big parking area makes it easier to come by car.

Overall, a very nice place.

places.address: 6 Chome-2 Rinkaicho, Edogawa City, Tokyo 134-0086, Japan

places.generalDescription: Jonanjima Seaside Park is a waterfront park located in Jonanjima, Ota-ku, offering stunning views of Tokyo Bay and Haneda Airport. The park features sandy and grassy areas, a campsite, barbecue area, and a skateboarding plaza. It's a popular spot for families and people of all ages to enjoy recreational activities like grilling and bird-watching.

sources.snippet: Though many of the region‚Äôs most pristine beaches are an hour or two away in Chiba and Kamakura, Tokyo Bay also offers several recreational beach areas, including Kasai Kaihin Park, Shiokaze Park, Odaiba Seaside Park, and Jonanjima Seaside Park. Take a day off and journey to any of these destinations to enjoy grilling, bird-watching, and other recreational activities. During the hot and humid summer months, these parks abound with children playing in the water and local residents looking to enjoy the cool sea breeze and pleasant views.
sources.siteName: The Official Tokyo Travel Guide, GO TOKYO
sources.shortName: Enjoy the Oceanside at Tokyo Bay Beaches

places.name: Jonanjima Seaside Park

reviews.text:
2022.10.23
Overlooking Haneda Airport and Tokyo Port, it is a dynamic place that touch the heart of travel and also make you feel insignificant...

Nice spot and park for plane watching..dog walking and fishing!
Parking available till 9pm cost is 100¬•/30mins.

Windy, spacious, BBQ spot, camping site. All of it is true for this place. It's beautiful, and you can have a nice nap in your tent. Near the airport so you can checkout plane every 10/15 minutes. Many photographers comes here to take photo of takeoff. The beach has quite the high tide. But within swimming level.
The information desks are helpful, i had cut my finger during setting up tent. They gave medicine and bandaids with such care.
Definitely worth to visit the place if u want to spend a nice evening, don't forget to take the tent. It tends to get hot there

places.address: 4 Chome-2-2 Jonanjima, Ota City, Tokyo 143-0002, Japan

places.generalDescription: Shirahama Beach is a popular destination on the Izu Peninsula, known for its bustling atmosphere and stunning natural beauty. The beach features white sand and turquoise waters with picturesque mountain views. It is a part of Shimoda, a charming beach town that offers various attractions such as hotels, restaurants, and beach shacks. While Shirahama Beach is the most popular choice for many visitors, some opt for the neighboring and less crowded Shirahama Ohama.

sources.snippet: Shirahama Beach stands out as one of Izu‚Äôs liveliest beaches, boasting a vast expanse of beautiful sandy shores stretching up to 700 meters. Fronting the national highway, the beach offers a sense of spaciousness, drawing visitors from across the nation, including many surfers and young enthusiasts. Despite its popularity, Shirahama Beach remains generously spacious, ensuring you‚Äôll have ample room to enjoy the ocean and sand, even during peak seasons.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Beaches Near Tokyo To Discover In Summer 2024

sources.snippet: Regarded as one of Izu Peninsula‚Äôs top beach destinations, Shirahama Beach attracts visitors from Tokyo and other surrounding prefectures primarily because of its pure white sand beach. If you‚Äôre a fan of surfing, this may also be an ideal location for you. The beach is located almost 3 hours away from Central Tokyo so if you want to enjoy the area, it is recommended to travel earlier in the day or stay overnight.
sources.shortName: Best Free Beaches Near Tokyo for Summer 2023

sources.snippet: Shirahama Beach, located on the Izu Peninsula, is a bit further away from Tokyo but its stunning white sand and turquoise waters make the journey worthwhile. It‚Äôs one of the most beautiful beaches in the region, offering excellent snorkeling opportunities. The beach is also known for its nearby hot springs, so you can enjoy a relaxing soak after a day of swimming and sunbathing.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: One of the most popular beaches near Tokyo, Shirahama translates as White Sand Beach, so you know what you're going to get here. Shirahama Omaha is the main beach here, although there are two other beaches to explore. At only 700 m long, Shirahama is a fairly small beach that quickly becomes crowded in the summer.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

sources.snippet: Although this would be a long day trip from Tokyo‚Äîit‚Äôs best to spend at least a night in Shimoda city‚Äî Shirahama Beach is undoubtedly the best beach near Tokyo. Moreover, there are plenty of other fantastic spots to swim on the Izu Peninsula, with another personal favorite being Kujuppama Beach.
sources.shortName: What Are the Best Beaches Near Tokyo?

places.name: Shirahama beach

reviews.text: Very beautiful white sand beach that was not crowded. You can rent sunbeds and a parasol for the day for a reasonable price. Beach security and a few locals ladies were going around keeping the beach clean. There is a 7/11 just across the street, offering ice cold drinks, snacks and beach necessities. All in all a very relaxing experience.

Nice beach! Water is great but the sand is getting a bit darker.
We noticed a lot of jellyfish so be careful! Many dead in the sand, we saw 2 in the water.
Beautiful sand and great waves! Doesn't have a fresh water shower, but has a creek + at the surf rental shop you can pay for a showerüåäüèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüåû

places.generalDescription: Irita Beach is a hidden gem that offers an ideal setting for both surfing and swimming enthusiasts. Nestled between rocky outcrops, this beach boasts soft sand and crystal-clear waters, making it perfect for families looking to enjoy a day in the sun. While it may not be as visually stunning as some other beaches in Izu, its waves are excellent for boarding‚Äîjust remember to bring flippers if you plan on using a bodyboard during lifeguard hours.

sources.snippet: A post shared by Sekine, Yuto(@s.yuto__) (Sekine, Yuto(@s.yuto__)). A row of sycamore trees along the shoreline creates a tropical mood at Irita Beach. The contrast between the blue of the sea and the whiteness of the sand is beautiful, and the area has been used as a filming location for commercials, TV shows, and movies.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches That Are Accessible By Train From Tokyo

places.name: Irita Beach

reviews.text: visited  this beach to wait for  someone.Nice place for walking around,nice atmosphere and colder in the evening.
We come here every year, but this time the water felt the warmest it's been in the past 10 years. The kids could enjoy swimming without shivering from the cold!
Such a beautiful beach. The view was so mesmerizing. Would love to visit this place again someday.

places.generalDescription: Kanagawa Prefectural Shonan Coast Park is a stunning destination that offers a delightful blend of natural beauty and recreational activities. Stretching from Kamakura to Chigasaki, this long beach park is renowned for its vibrant surfing scene, making it a hotspot for both seasoned surfers and beginners alike. The picturesque backdrop of Enoshima Island enhances the experience, especially during sunset when the sky transforms into a canvas of colors with Mt. Fuji standing majestically in the distance.

sources.snippet: The Shonan Coast stretches over a few dozen kilometers along the shoreline of Kanagawa Prefecture. Many of the beaches along the Shonan Coast are popular for sunbathing and swimming, while surfing, windsurfing and stand-up paddle boarding can also be done at some of them. Being close to the city, the rules at some of the beaches can be fairly strict.
sources.shortName: Beaches near Tokyo

places.name: Kanagawa Prefectural Shonan Coast Park

reviews.text: Ideal for a walk along the beach. In winter you can see a beautiful Mount Fuji.

We watched the sun set over Mt Fuji, with surfers swimming in the sea. It was truly an amazing sight, I think it might be the best sunset I've seen in a long time!
There's free toilets as well (not super clean, but they do the job).
You can see a beautiful view of the Fuji mountain you can spend time here to get the best view of the Fuji This is the big lake so you can drive/cycling/Walk around it you can campaign here

places.generalDescription: Kamakura Yuigahama Beach is a popular destination for both locals and tourists due to its convenient location near the city center, clean sandy shores, and ideal waves for surfing. Visitors can enjoy swimming, beach facilities, and nearby eateries at this long stretch of coastline. After exploring the historical attractions in Kamakura, such as the Daibutsu-ji 'big Buddha,' travelers can head to Yuigahama Beach for some fun in the sun.

sources.snippet: Kamakura is one of the top day trip destinations from Tokyo, albeit usually for attractions like the Daibutsu-ji "big Buddha" and other relics from the time centuries ago when Kamakura was Japan's capital. However, Kamakura (and Kanagawa prefecture in general) sits right on the sea, which means that many of the best beaches near Tokyo are here. In particular, Yuigahama Beach is popular for its proximity to the center of the city, clean sand, and great waves for the surfing crowd.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Just an hour away from Tokyo by train, Yuigahama Beach in Kamakura is a popular destination for both locals and tourists. This beach is known for its wide sandy shore and gentle waves, making it an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, and even picnicking with family and friends. For the adventurous at heart, the beach is home to several surf schools, offering a great opportunity for beginners to catch their first wave.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: If your search for beaches near Tokyo is more about convenience than ambiance, you might choose Yuigahama Beach, which is in the popular Tokyo day-trip destination of Kamakura. One day to structure a trip here is to spend the morning seeing the sights of Kamakura city, then heading to the beach in the afternoon (or vice-versa).
sources.shortName: What Are the Best Beaches Near Tokyo?

sources.snippet: Yuigahama is a 20-minute walk from Kamakura Station or a five-minute stroll from Yuigahama Station. The swimming and shopping options by the beach make it very popular come summer when the stores open. It‚Äôs also wheelchair accessible.
sources.shortName: Sun, Sand and Sea: The Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Yuigahama Beach: From Kamakura Station, it is a 15-minute walk. The beach is only five minutes from Wadazuka, Yuigahama and Hase stations on the Enoden Line.
sources.shortName: Kamakura Beaches | Travel Japan

places.name: Kamakura Yuigahama Beach

reviews.text: Yuigahama Beach in Kamakura offers a laid-back vibe with stunning ocean views. The beach is perfect for a peaceful walk, sunbathing, or enjoying water sports. Surrounded by cafes and shops, it's an ideal spot to relax after exploring Kamakura's temples.

I was truly impressed by my trip to Kamakura. This beautiful town has such a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and the locals are incredibly friendly. One of the highlights was driving along the scenic coastal road of Kanagawa ‚Äì absolutely breathtaking, especially on a sunny day. During the road trip, I noticed lots of people out enjoying the sea, many with surfboards ready for a swim. The area also had charming garage sales and local stalls dotted along the way, adding to the laid-back, seaside vibe. Kamakura is a perfect blend of nature, culture, and community ‚Äì definitely a place worth visiting again.

Lovely spot to visit after either a visit to the Buddha or hiking behind the Buddha. Water is clean and with some waves . Surfers are there catching them . There is a lifeguard watching in designated spots. As well, you can get an umbrella or chair at any of the nearby beach restaurants for a fee.

places.generalDescription: Sotoura Beach is a great alternative to the crowded Shirahama Ohama Beach. It's perfect for various activities like swimming, snorkeling, and sea kayaking. The beach offers clear and beautiful ocean water with opportunities to spot marine life such as crabs, hermit crabs, shrimp, and small fish. Restrooms, restaurants, and shops are available nearby for convenience. The waves are gentle here compared to other beaches in Shimoda, making it suitable for families with children.

sources.snippet: At Sotoura Beach, the waves are calm and the beach is quiet. The white sand cove, which continues for 470 meters, is particularly clear. Many people enjoy windsurfing and sea kayaking here.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches That Are Accessible By Train From Tokyo

places.name: Sotoura Beach

reviews.text: Good beach with hardly any people however by the time we left, a lot more people were arriving. The water was mostly clear and basically no waves so you can swim/float freely! There are toilets but no showers. Free parking though compared to the main Shirahama beach.

Not a great experience for our family with young kids-several dead fish and a good amount of trash washed up on the shore. And random pokey things in the sand that hurt our feet. Probably a better beach experience if you're there to swim and not play in the sand.

The beach was beautiful and very calm. No waves at all. Also almost nobody in the morning but there is no convenience store nearby. The shower and toilet is dirt and smelly, I think no one used in a long time.

places.generalDescription: Odaiba Beach is a popular urban beachfront promenade and recreation area located on a reclaimed land at the edge of Tokyo Bay. It offers stunning views of the city and is surrounded by entertainment and shopping centers. While swimming is not allowed due to water quality, visitors can still enjoy the sandy beach, take leisurely walks along the 800-meter-long stretch, and relax in the adjacent Odaiba Beach Park.

sources.snippet: What this artificial beach lacks in authenticity, it makes up for with ease of access. This is the only beach within Tokyo itself, so if you want to enjoy water and sand without straying far from the city, this is the place to do it.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

places.name: Odaiba Beach

reviews.text:
As I walked through Odaiba Park in Tokyo this evening, the night air crisp and cool, a song suddenly came to mind ‚ÄúEvery Time You Go Away‚Äù by Paul Young. The familiar melody echoed in my thoughts, and I couldn't help but remember the lyrics:
"Every time you go away, you take a piece of me with you."
It felt so fitting. I thought of the days when my ex-girlfriend and I used to walk hand in hand along Sentosa Beach in Singapore, the sound of the waves mixing with our laughter, our hearts in sync as we strolled along the shore. We had even talked about getting married soon, dreaming of a future together. It felt like nothing could tear us apart.
But now, as I walked alone in Odaiba, the song in my mind became a haunting reminder of what we lost. Every time you go away, those words echoed louder, a painful reminder that with her departure, she took a piece of me. Our dreams, our love, the future we had planned... all of it vanished, leaving behind only the ache of what could have been.
Tonight, as I walked through Odaiba, the song reminded me of the heartbreak, of the love that once was, and of the plans that would never come true. Yet, no matter how far we've drifted apart, those memories, and that piece of me she took with her, will forever be imprinted on my heart.

It is a definitely nice place to have sunset here in Tokyo and enjoy the afternoon breeze while seeing The Rainbow Bridge and Tokyo skyline. I love that this place can be accessed easily for everyone, including the children and disabled people. It has many white sands on the beach and jogging tracks. There are green areas available for people to have a picnic, and restaurants are available.

One of Tokyo's underrated romantic spots! Sunset at Odaiba Beach hits different , city lights, Rainbow Bridge, and that salty breeze. Perfect place for a cute date or just vibing by the water. Don't skip this one!

places.address: 1 Chome-4 Daiba, Minato City, Tokyo 135-0091, Japan

places.generalDescription: Moriya Beach, located in Katsuura, is a popular destination known for its stunning open scenery and crystal-clear ocean. It has been recognized as one of the top 100 designated water baths and beaches in Japan. The beach offers calm waves, plentiful beach stands, and a pleasant setting suitable for visitors of all ages. Nestled in a cove, Moriya Beach provides an island-like escape with tranquil waters and sandy shores.

sources.snippet: Located in Katsuura City, Chiba, Moriya Beach features a beautiful sea with a red torii gate at its edge, offering a distinctly Japanese landscape. It has been selected for the "100 Best Beaches of Japan," "100 Best Swimming Beaches," and "Japan's Top 88 Swimming Beaches" due to its excellent water quality, beauty, comfort, convenience, and safety, making it a popular swimming destination.
sources.shortName: Escape the Concrete Jungle! 5 Gorgeous Beaches Near Tokyo Perfect for Summer

sources.snippet: A post shared by ÂãùÊµ¶„Éñ„É´„Éº„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà(@katsuura_blue) (ÂãùÊµ¶„Éñ„É´„Éº„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà(@katsuura_blue)). Moriya Beach has been selected as one of the ‚Äú100 best beaches in Japan‚Äù and ‚Äú100 best bathing places‚Äù in the country too. The warm, clear waters and white sandy beaches are characteristic of the area, and the surrounding coastline is shaped by magnificent scenery, including cliffs sculpted by sea erosion.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches That Are Accessible By Train From Tokyo

sources.snippet: Moriya Beach, situated in Katsuura, stands out as one of the premier spots near Tokyo for a refreshing swim. Here, you‚Äôll discover pristine waters and immaculate sands, offering an exceptional swimming experience. Despite its popularity among both Japanese locals and international visitors, Moriya Beach boasts ample space, ensuring you‚Äôll find a comfortable spot to relax.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Beaches Near Tokyo To Discover In Summer 2024

sources.snippet: Moriya Beach, located in Katsuura of Chiba Prefecture, is known for its crystal-clear waters and is recognized as one of Japan's top 100 beaches. This 300-meter stretch of beach is perfect for swimming and sunbathing, offering a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo. You can reach Moriya Beach in about two and a half hours by train.
sources.shortName: 4 Beautiful Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Nestled in Chiba Prefecture, Moriya Beach has become a popular tourist attraction among Japanese and foreigners alike. Its seasonal pink sand beach, which is made up of a combination of coral fragments and other marine components. Tourists are invited to swim, sunbathe and play watersports when they visit the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Free Beaches Near Tokyo for Summer 2023

places.name: Moriya Beach

reviews.text:
It's a beautiful beach, but the waves can sometimes be big.
If you have small children, I recommend Okitsu Beach, which is a little further south. It's a calm, shallow beach with no waves even during typhoons. The water is also incredibly clear!

Beautiful beach! We went on mid of July weekend, even though wasn't crowded. The climate for swimming was perfect and the water was very clear. Had a great time with friends and family. ü§©

Still only 4 star because of the moss in the water here and there.
The beach is nice but nothing special overall. Not super crowded even at the end of July but the water is very low and it's not allowed to go "far" from the beach swimming and I didn't like it

places.generalDescription: Zushi Beach, located in Kanagawa Prefecture, is a popular coastal stretch known for its scenic views of Enoshima Island and Mount Fuji. The beach offers activities such as windsurfing, yachting, and paddleboarding. It features calm waters suitable for swimming and is surrounded by trendy cafes and restaurants offering various dining options. Additionally, the area boasts shops and cafes perfect for relaxation after a day of beach fun.

sources.snippet: Zushi Beach is extremely popular for all beach activities, and for those who need to stop to refuel on caffeine (or simply want to play spectator), the good news is that the coastline is dotted with coffee shops, bars and restaurants right by the action. Look out for Beach Muffin ‚Äì a vegan cafe specializing in delicious handmade baked goods. The far end of the beach, by the marina, meanwhile, is one of the best spots for windsurfing near Tokyo.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Zushi Beach, located in Kanagawa Prefecture, is another excellent beach near Tokyo. Known for its calm waters and beautiful views of Mount Fuji on clear days, it‚Äôs a popular spot for yachting, windsurfing, and paddleboarding. The beach is lined with trendy cafes and restaurants, offering a variety of dining options from traditional Japanese cuisine to international dishes.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Located approximately one hour from Tokyo in  Kanagawa Prefecture,  Zushi Beach is known for its relaxed atmosphere and vibrant beach culture. It‚Äôs a popular spot for water sports such as windsurfing and paddle boarding. To get there, take the JR Yokosuka Line from  Tokyo Station to  Zushi Station, then take a short bus or 15-minute walk.
sources.shortName: 4 Beautiful Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Known as one of  the most frequently visited  beaches by residents around Tokyo and Kanagawa, Zushi Beach displays various food shops and some water activities. It is less than 2 hours away from Tokyo, and it‚Äôs accessible by car or train. Besides water activities, there are also other options for you when you plan to visit the place.
sources.shortName: Best Free Beaches Near Tokyo for Summer 2023

sources.snippet: Rounding out this list is Zushi Beach, which is located just beyond Kamakura and Enoshima, and objectively is very similar to them. Where Zushi stands out, however, is that it faces west, which means that on a clear day you can enjoy views of Mt. Fuji as you swim or catch rays.
sources.shortName: What Are the Best Beaches Near Tokyo?

sources.snippet: Easily reached from Tokyo, Zushi Beach is one of the most popular in the area, but don't let that put you off. This well-equipped beach has everything you need for a great Japanese beach day.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

places.name: Zushi Beach

reviews.text:
A Serene Beach Escape Near Tokyo ‚Äì The Perfect Spot to Enjoy Nature

If you're looking for a peaceful beach getaway where you can truly immerse yourself in nature, this is the place to be. Located just under an hour from Tokyo, it offers a refreshing escape from the city's fast-paced energy. The moment you arrive, you'll notice the crystal-clear water and the calm, gentle waves, making it an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, or simply relaxing by the shore. Unlike many other beaches, this one is remarkably clean, with very little litter, allowing visitors to fully enjoy the natural beauty without distractions.

One of the best things about this location is the balance between tranquility and convenience. While the beach itself is serene and uncrowded, there are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby, making it easy to grab a delicious meal or a refreshing drink after a day by the sea. Whether you're planning a romantic getaway, a solo retreat, or a fun day out with friends and family, this beach has something for everyone.

For those who love photography or simply enjoy breathtaking views, the scenery here is spectacular-especially during sunrise and sunset, when the sky paints the ocean in stunning shades of orange and pink. If you're looking for a stress-free, nature-filled beach experience without traveling too far from Tokyo, this hidden gem is an absolute must-visit!

I took the train from Ishigawa and arrived at Zushi around 4PM. Consider that bathing is allowed during lifeguard's working hours (until 5PM). I Went directly to the beach. Tere were not a lot of people. You are met by a sign explaining the rules at the beach and considering that I have large tattoos over my body, I decided that I won't try my luck, so I just dipped my toes. The water was very warm, the sand is fine - like silk. At this time the beach was relatively quiet, considering that it's the beginning of the school year and it's kind of late. I managed to capture the sun going down - beautiful and fulfilling picture.
There are some bars and other venues which I did not visit, because it was after or near their closing time.
The beach was generally clean, but still there was some trash left here and there (also some thrown by the sea), hence the 4 stars.
Still a great place to visit!

Seems to be popular among people.
The toilets can be little dirty. The restaurant/beach huts don't allow to use their restrooms. You can take some stuff as rental from any of the restaurants/beach huts.
The parking was around 500yen for 30mins.

places.generalDescription: Isshiki Beach, located in Zushi City near Kamakura, is a serene and picturesque sandy retreat that offers a more tranquil alternative to the popular Zushi Beach. Surrounded by rock formations and lush greenery, this beach provides a peaceful escape just a short bus ride away from the bustling city of Tokyo. With its gentle waters and stunning views of Mt. Fuji on clear days, Isshiki Beach has garnered attention as one of the best beaches in the world.

sources.snippet: Just a 15-minute bus ride away from busy Zushi lies pretty Isshiki Beach. It‚Äôs distinctly quieter than its surrounding neighborhoods, largely thanks to the rock formations and greenery that create a coastal enclave. The fact that there is no direct train access gives Isshiki Beach more of a local feel.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: You may well be familiar with Isshiki Beach, as it has garnered attention from various media outlets, including CNN, for being one of the world‚Äôs finest beaches. Isshiki Beach boasts tranquil waters and a captivating sunset view, often enhanced by the sight of Mount Fuji across the bay. During the bustling summer months, the beach comes alive with live music performances, drawing music enthusiasts to relax and enjoy the vibes.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Beaches Near Tokyo To Discover In Summer 2024

sources.snippet: A post shared by LUKE(„É´„Éº„ÇØ)(@luke20180913) (LUKE(„É´„Éº„ÇØ)(@luke20180913)). The beach in front of the Hayama Imperial Villa was selected as one of CNN‚Äôs ‚Äú100 Selected Beaches of the World‚Äù. On the south side of Isshiki Beach, there is a cape called ‚ÄúKoiso no Hana‚Äù that juts out into Sagami Bay with a lawn on its upper surface, where visitors can enjoy playing on the shore when the tide is out.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches That Are Accessible By Train From Tokyo

sources.snippet: A lovely laid-back beach not far from Tokyo, this scenic location is a great place for families and anyone who wants a beach vacation without all the fuss. Located close to the popular Zushi Beach, Isshiki is every bit as lovely, offering views of Mount Fuji on clear days. But it's a lot less crowded, making it ideal if you want a more low-key day on the beach.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

sources.snippet: Isshiki is a picturesque beach often used to film movies in the location because of its mind-boggling view. I was taken aback when I witnessed a sunset on this beach as it stood by all the reviews people have given me for this beach. It is one of the beaches near Tokyo with less crowd and better than the Zushi beach which is just overrated now.
sources.shortName: 8 Beaches Near Tokyo With Less Crowd | Lesser-known Tokyo Beaches

sources.snippet: Located right behind Hayama Shiosai Park, is the quaint Isshiki Beach. This is another beach in Hayama that is popular with those with children. What makes this beach special is that well-behaved dogs are also allowed on the beach with their owners.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Beaches Near Tokyo

places.name: Isshiki Beach

reviews.text: The beach is right next to the museum and the emperor's villa. The kids loved this beach because there were so many crabs on the rocks! We can also rent boats, fishing rods, etc. Water quality is very good!

It is ok to escape Tokyo on a sunny weekend day. The beach is reasonable, waves are gentle, perfect for small kids. There is absolutely no structure: no shower, toilets, shops, nothing. A few school giving stand up and life saving classes. The water is cold but not freezing.

Relaxing beach right on the coast of Hayama. Went on a Saturday afternoon and it was quite crowded, the same level as neighboring beaches such as Zushi, and parking is difficult and expensive (400 yen for 20 minutes), if you can find a spot. Water is much nicer than other spots , and has some beach houses that don't interfere with the atmosphere. Good for families and smaller groups, saw lots of dogs and kids.
No showers unless you want to pay, there's a public toilet, and you can pay to dispose some trash as well.

places.address: 1083 Horiuchi, Hayama, Miura District, Kanagawa 240-0111, Japan

places.generalDescription: Southern Beach Chigasaki, located in Kanagawa prefecture and less than two hours from Tokyo, is a hidden gem with its broad sandy shores and stunning views of Mt. Fuji. Whether you're into swimming, surfing, or simply taking a leisurely stroll along the coastline, this beach has something for everyone. The Southern C monument and picturesque rock formations add to the charm of this serene location. Visitors can also enjoy browsing through local restaurants and small businesses nearby.

sources.snippet: In terms of walks, Southern Beach in Chigasaki is a feast on the eyes at any given time of year. The beach‚Äôs ‚ÄúSouthern C‚Äù monument is a famous marriage and photo spot, and wandering onward leads strollers to plenty of restaurants and small businesses along the coastline. From the beach, you can see Enoshima Island in the east, Mt Fuji in the west, and large rock formations including Eboshi Iwa, a hat-shaped rock, ahead.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: What's better than a beach with millions of grains of golden sand, almost no tourists, and a location less than two hours from Tokyo by car or public transportation?. One that offers sweeping views of Mt. Fuji, of course!. Southern Beach in Chigasaki city, Kanagawa prefecture is definitely one of the best beaches near Tokyo, whether you come in summer for a swim or a surf, or for a pensive walk in winter when Fujisan's snow cap is at its most prominent.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: There are many beaches along Sagami Bay to choose from, with the best ones on the Shonan Coast. The area is known as Japan‚Äôs surfer‚Äôs paradise, though this destination is perfect for all different marine activities. Beaches in Enoshima and Kugenuma are crowded in the summer, but as you go further west to Chigasaki Beach, the atmosphere becomes more local.
sources.shortName: Six Best Secluded Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Just one hour away from Tokyo by train lies in Chigasaki‚Äôs Southern Beach. It was renamed in 1999, in homage to the Japanese band Southern All Stars, who hail from nearby and used the beach as a setting for an album cover. The beach is a popular photo spot, including for weddings, thanks to the Southern C sculpture on the seafront.
sources.shortName: Sun, Sand and Sea: The Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Located on the Shonan Coast, this is a well-equipped beach with great amenities like lifeguards and beach huts. However, the further you get away from the center of the beach, the quieter it gets, so if you're looking for relaxation, you can find that here, too.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

sources.snippet: Chigasaki beach in Kanagawa is one of the most peaceful beaches in Tokyo with less crowd. The view in this beach will definitely amaze you but you gotta find a perfect spot. All you need to do is walk a few steps from the shore.
sources.shortName: 8 Beaches Near Tokyo With Less Crowd | Lesser-known Tokyo Beaches

places.name: Southern Beach Chigasaki

reviews.text:
Southern Beach Chigasaki is a picturesque coastal destination located in Chigasaki City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. Renowned for its beautiful sandy shores and vibrant beach culture, it attracts both locals and tourists alike. The beach stretches approximately 2 kilometers, making it perfect for sunbathing, beach sports, and leisurely strolls along the shore.

One of the most appealing aspects of Southern Beach is its relaxed atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy various activities, from surfing and beach volleyball to simply soaking up the sun. The beach is equipped with facilities such as showers, restrooms, and rental shops for beach gear, ensuring a comfortable experience for all.

In the summer, Southern Beach comes alive with events, including music festivals, beach parties, and food stalls offering delicious local treats. The vibrant beach scene is complemented by stunning views of the Enoshima Island and Mount Fuji in the distance, making it an ideal spot for photography and nature lovers.

Nearby, you can find a variety of cafes and restaurants serving fresh seafood and other local specialties, adding to the overall charm of the area. As the sun sets, the beach transforms into a serene retreat, perfect for unwinding after a day of activities.

Overall, Southern Beach Chigasaki is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a blend of relaxation and adventure. Whether you're looking to engage in water sports, enjoy delicious food, or simply relax by the sea, this beautiful beach has something for everyone.

It is very convenient to go by car (just used the expressway to avoid traffic). There are parking lots nearby and cost 2,000yen per day. There are toilets on the beach area and paid shower rooms (about 500yen). You can also rent parasol, body boards and floaters.

The beach has great and big waves perfect for surfers. Surfing is allowed before 8:30am and after 5pm so people can enjoy swimming on the beach.

There are nearby cafes, convenience stores and restaurants if you don't want to bring food.

There is a barbecue area nearby the beach and cost around 10,000yen.

This beach is a good place for a quick getaway to beat the summer heat. Kids and adults will definitely enjoy the splash of beach waves.

This is very beautiful place where you can enjoy good sand and wide space for relaxing and enjoying. The water is very clean and nice. Public shower and bathrooms is available. Additionally, nearby you can find fishing boats for renting and shops to buy bait for your trip.

places.generalDescription: Katase Higashihama Beach, located in an urban cove, is a popular spot for surfing and relaxation. It has beach bars and eateries, as well as a low-tide causeway to an island. The beach was recognized as one of the 88 most recommended beaches in Japan by the Ministry of the Environment.

sources.snippet: If you're short on time, head to Katase Higashihama, right by Enoshima Island. Just a short walk from the station, the spot has a more relaxed attitude to tattoos, alcohol and pets, and boasts a huge range of amenities including toilets, showers, chair and umbrella rentals, parking, shops and restaurants. It's not the prettiest because the dark sand looks a bit like cigarette ash, but you can hardly see it for all the beach umbrellas.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Katase Higashihama Beach, or Enoshima Beach, located near the famous  Enoshima Island, is a favorite among Tokyoites for its lively beach culture and beautiful scenery. Take the Odakyu Line from  Shinjuku Station to Katase-Enoshima Station to reach it. The beach offers stunning views of Mount Fuji on clear days and a variety of water activities.
sources.shortName: 4 Beautiful Beaches Near Tokyo

places.name: Katase Higashihama Beach

reviews.text: Many surfers were busy near the beach with their surfing boards. Some restaurants are beside the beach. Fuji san can also be seen from the beach, though very far away.

The beach is wide and the waves are moderate.  If they are a little rougher you could almost surf.  The sand is grey and fine grained.   The beach area is reasonably clean, but there is still garbage here and there.
I really like to go in this beach, it's not far away from Tokyo which makes it incredibly convenient.

places.generalDescription: Onjuku Chuo Beach, situated in Chiba Prefecture and easily accessible from central Tokyo by train, is a sought-after destination for surfers due to its exceptional wave breaks. The beach boasts golden sands, clear blue waters, and iconic palm trees along the shore, making it an idyllic spot for beach enthusiasts. Visitors can also delve into the area's rich history or partake in invigorating water sports such as surfing and beach volleyball.

sources.snippet: Onjuku Beach, located in Chiba Prefecture, is a two-hour train ride from Tokyo but well worth the journey. This beach is famous for its white sand, clear blue waters, and the iconic palm trees lining the shore. The beach‚Äôs surfing conditions are excellent, and it‚Äôs a popular spot for beach volleyball.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Onjuku is a white sand beach that is famous amongst surfing enthusiasts and night barbecues. It‚Äôs Acapulco‚Äôs sister city and is best known for the beach on the Pacific coast in the Boso peninsula. It‚Äôs a small beach hence not all of the things are easily accessible.
sources.shortName: 8 Beaches Near Tokyo With Less Crowd | Lesser-known Tokyo Beaches

places.name: Onjuku Chuo Beach

reviews.text: Perfect place to enjoy the summer I went there alone but I enjoyed it so much . The üõü life saver people are so active and really doing their job well protecting the people in the beach area. I really enjoy a lot .Lot of restaurants also infront of the beach

The surf can become quite busy, especially during peak hours, but the vibrant atmosphere makes it all worthwhile. Remember to bring along your ¬•1000 for a day of parking, ensuring your spot close to the shoreline. From July 1 to September 30, between the hours of 8:30 AM and 5:00 PM, certain sections of the beach are cordoned off, providing a safe haven for swimmers to fully enjoy the ocean's inviting waves. Experience the lively beach environment while reaping the benefits of designated swimming areas during the summer months.

Excellent beach - very clean, very bright, very safe ‚Ä¶ waves and sand are very pleasant for anyone to enjoy and relax ‚Ä¶ seems best for surfing as I could see many people enjoying the surfing while their young kids are enjoying the sand and shore waters.

places.address: 31 Suka, Onjuku, Isumi District, Chiba 299-5106, Japan

places.generalDescription: Atami Sun Beach is a picturesque sandy strip flanked by palm trees and resort hotels, making it a popular spot for moonlight walks and summer fireworks. Conveniently located near rental shops, main roads, and a charming marina, this beach is ideal for summer fun. Visitors can easily find nearby restaurants and convenience stores to grab a bite or bring food onto the sand. The tranquil atmosphere makes it perfect for relaxation and enjoying nature's beauty.

sources.snippet: For those seeking to extend beach hours, the fun doesn‚Äôt end at dusk over at Atami Sun Beach. This sandy beach lined with palm trees lights up blue each sunset till 10pm, and in the summer, there are regular fireworks displays to add to the color spectacle. Events draw in large crowds, creating a festival atmosphere without the fumes ‚Äì smoking is forbidden here.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Another popular beach near Tokyo, Atami Sun Beach offers a 400-meter-long stretch of coarse sand, incredibly clear water, and even the curative waters of local hot springs. Understandably crowded in summer, this easily accessible local beach is a great option at any time of year.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

places.name: Atami Sun Beach

reviews.text:
Watching the **Atami Sea Fireworks** was an unforgettable experience. I sat right on the beach, feeling incredibly close to the stunning display. As the fireworks burst into the dark sky, the entire region lit up, and the impact of the sound was exhilarating.

The show lasted about 20 minutes, with the first minute and the last two minutes being particularly spectacular, as fireworks shot up in rapid succession. The atmosphere was electric, and I found myself completely captivated by the colors and sounds.

The beach offers plenty of space for viewing, and I appreciated that it wasn't overly crowded, possibly because the fireworks show is a monthly event. Just bring your own mat for a comfortable spot on the sand, and you're all set.

Overall, the Atami Sea Fireworks was a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a magical evening by the sea!

A beach popular with locals as well as tourists to Atami. There is a breakwater promenade on the south side if the beach, hosting a pier for recreational boats, and is a nice place to sit and relax in the evenings. The sun is strongest here in the mornings, given that it faces east.

We visited Sun Beach in August 2025. Although the posted swimming hours are 9:00-16:00, in reality most continue to swim after that, just without lifeguards. The sand is soft and the water is fairly shallow and calm. It is very nice to come at night for the illuminations. There were also many families doing fireworks in the sand. There are coin lockers, toilets, showers and footwashes (free), and dumpsters on the beach for trash.

places.generalDescription: Enoshima, a small Japanese island just off the coast and connected to the mainland by a bridge, is a popular tourist destination. It features the Enoshima Shrine, an English-style garden, and caves. The island also boasts an observation tower with a 360-degree panoramic view that includes sights like Mt. Fuji and Ohshima Island.

sources.snippet: Like many of the most convenient beaches near Tokyo, the ones you find on Enoshima Island are at least as noteworthy for their accessibility as they are for the quality of the sand or water. To this end, many people sun themselves on any number of Enoshima beaches after riding the historical tram car from Kamakura onto the island.
sources.shortName: What Are the Best Beaches Near Tokyo?

sources.snippet: If you want to experience a quick summer weekend escape like the Tokyo locals do it, then head straight to Enoshima. This laid back beach hub is just over an hour from Tokyo and about 40 minutes from Yokohama by train, making it one of the easiest places to escape to. But be warned, in peak season it‚Äôs incredibly popular.
sources.shortName: Beaches near Tokyo - 5 of the Best | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

places.name: Enoshima

reviews.text:
Nice island to visit. Suggest to go early and after visiting, seeing the sites and work your hunger, you arrive in time to try all the street food or restaurants the Enoshima proposes.
I also early morning and on a beautiful day, more chances to see Mount Fuji like we did

A wonderful summer getaway spot for those living in or visiting Tokyo! It's only a short train ride away, making it perfect for a day trip.

One thing to watch out for is the weather-clear days give you the best experience and views. The island is full of delicious food options, and if you want to save energy, there's even an escalator that takes you up toward the Sea Candle faster.

With so many scenic spots and attractions scattered around the island, you can easily enjoy Enoshima from morning until night.
Sadly the weather wasn't amazing, but that didn't ruin this small but beautiful island. I haven't fully explored it, but that only means there's a reason to come back when the sun is shining.

places.generalDescription: Onjuku Beach, located in the Sotobo area of Chiba prefecture, is a hidden gem near Tokyo. With its white sandy beaches and clear blue waters facing the Pacific Ocean, it offers a serene escape from the city without the crowds. The warm climate throughout the year makes it an ideal destination for beach lovers. While the beach itself is clean and picturesque, there are limited facilities nearby, with only a few stores and restaurants in the vicinity.

sources.snippet: Speaking once again of Chiba prefecture, Onjuku Beach is another great choice if you're looking for beaches near Tokyo, but don't want to venture too far from the city. Located near Isumi city, Onjuku Beach remains obscure even among many Japanese, which means it's unlikely you'll encounter significant crowds here, even if you visit on a weekend or during the middle of summer. How to Get There: Ride the Wakashio Limited Express directly from Tokyo to Onjuku (80 mins, 1,940 yen).
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Reachable by an easy train ride from central Tokyo, Onjuku Beach is popular with surfers since it is known for having some of the best wave breaks anywhere near the Japanese capital. Like most places in Japan, this beach and the small coastal town surrounding it also have a rich and fascinating history, which you can explore if you want to break from the sun and the waves. Or you can just grab a board, head to the water, and surf the day away.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Tokyo: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

sources.snippet: Onjuku Beach, situated in the Sotobo area of Chiba prefecture, is a picturesque destination facing the Pacific Ocean. With its white sandy shores and stunning blue waters, Onjuku Beach enjoys a warm climate all year round. The addition of palm trees along the coastline enhances the tropical ambiance, creating a perfect vacation setting.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Beaches Near Tokyo To Discover In Summer 2024

sources.snippet: Located less than 2 hours away from Central Tokyo by car, Onjuku Beach showcases a wide array of activities that beach lovers can do when they visit the area. Some of them include surfing, sunbathing, swimming and strolling on the white sand beach. Furthermore, visitors can also do sightseeing around the area.
sources.shortName: Best Free Beaches Near Tokyo for Summer 2023

places.name: Onjuku Beach

reviews.text:
It brings back bittersweet, sentimental memories for people from long ago.
Simply put, memories of failed pick-up attempts.
You did well, comrade.

The sand is nice and pretty trash free. The water is sandy with some weeds. The waves are average size. Fun but not overwhelming. There is not much around in terms of stores and restaurants. Very nice views but a couple abandoned old hotels right on the beach detract from the appearance.

Beautiful beach with cristaline water. The temperature of the water is perfect for summer time. This beach also welcomes a lot of surfers. Services as parasol, chairs, etc. can be expensive but you can bring yours! Enjoy üåäüèñÔ∏è

places.address: Hama, Onjuku, Isumi District, Chiba 299-5107, Japan

places.generalDescription: Zaimokuza Beach in Kamakura is a well-maintained and clean beach with gentle waves, making it perfect for swimmers of all ages. During the summer, lifeguards ensure a safe experience. Rules restrict bringing drinks or having barbecues on the sand. This seaside town has a laid-back California surfer vibe and Zaimokuza Beach offers more space compared to the popular Yuigahama Beach.

sources.snippet: Though Kamakura is only a one-hour train ride from Tokyo, this seaside town, complete with a laid-back California surfer vibe, feels a world away. Of Kamakura's five beaches, Yuigahama is the most popular, and the first one you reach if you're walking from the train station; it can also get incredibly crowded, especially on weekends. For more space, keep walking instead to Zaimokuza, a broad stretch of sand fronted by waters that are generally gentle.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

places.name: Kamakura Zaimokuza Beach

reviews.text: Considering it was an evening in late December, there were surprisingly quite a few people still at the beach. I had a nice walk along the shore but it didn't seem like there were many facilities. Do note this rating is heavily biased as I love beaches.

Zaimokuza Beach is one of the closest beaches to Tokyo, making it an easy day trip. It does get quite crowded, and from what I observed, it feels more like a beach for tourists rather than locals.

The sand is darker, more black than white, which shouldn't come as a surprise in this region, though I've heard mixed opinions about it.

On the positive side, the beach itself is kept very clean. Litter is rare because it's regularly maintained. Unfortunately, the water in the bay tells a different story, it's dirty and filled with trash, which is disappointing to see.

The beach area itself is spacious, and when we visited in mid-August, the water was wonderfully warm, so warm that you didn't want to get out, if not for the scorching sun and blazing heat above.

Facilities are abundant: there are many beach bars, showers, lifeguard stations, and plenty of rental spots where you can get sunbeds, umbrellas, and all kinds of water toys and gear.

But here comes the worst part, the toilets. Portable Toi Toi cabins. Honestly, the worst experience ever. I can't recommend them at all!

Not worth going all the way to this beach when visiting Kamakura. The place has amazing temples, pretty distant from each other, and a lively shopping street. Going down the beach is time consuming and not worth it. The beach is not particularly nice, not really used for bathing and there are no facilities. I wish we had skipped it and spent more time sightseeing temples.

places.generalDescription: Katakai Beach is a popular spot for surfers and bodyboarders, located in the middle of the 60km Kujukuri Beach. The soft sand and crystal blue waters attract swimmers, while surfers take advantage of the waves. The area is known for its hamaguri clams, which can be enjoyed at beach huts along the shoreline. This beach offers public facilities such as toilets and outdoor showers, as well as rental shops for parasols and boogie boards.

sources.snippet: For a slightly cooler beach great facilities, drive just over an hour East from Tokyo to Katakai Beach. The surf and clarity of the water is dependent on the weather, but on a hot day with low wind this is a great place to escape the muggy Tokyo weather. This beach has plenty of parking, choose from its north or south parking lots.
sources.shortName: Six Best Secluded Beaches Near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Savor the local delicacy of grilled clams at this ocean paradise in Chiba. Located on the Boso Peninsula, Katakaiis a beach that‚Äôs popular with locals and visitors alike. Of course, it truly comes alive in the hotter months.
sources.shortName: Sun, Sand and Sea: The Best Beaches Near Tokyo

places.name: Katakai Beach

reviews.text: This part of the beach is nice. We had a wonderful moment here to catch up after our last meetup in over 15 years.

When we arrived at 8am in the morning it was like a little bit foggy as you'll see in the video . Water temperature was good and just be careful of the waves ..There's a clam as well but not allowed to get those . You'll be penalized if you do so.

Great. The Êµ∑„ÅÆÂÆ∂ was a great choice even a little bit of shade and shower was worth it.
Waves are good but there is a strong pull to each side. If you get two fast to the side the life guards come out to ask you to move to a safer spot.
Lots of parking available for 1000 yen let car.

places.address: Katakai, Kujukuri, Sambu District, Chiba 283-0104, Japan
